e4: Adopting the new policy reduces the legal liability associated with knowingly inflating earnings and fulfills a commitment to full transparency. While there's initial risk of misunderstanding, continued transparent communication can educate investors and maintain trust. Moreover, ethically accurate reporting tends to promote fair markets over time, protecting all investor classes.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should prioritize transparency, accuracy, and consistency, ensuring fair representation of financial figures without intentional bias or manipulation. It should consider all stakeholders, ensuring small and retail investors' interests aren't overshadowed by institutional behavior. Compliance with legal standards and clear communication on reporting methods are paramount to trust and accountability.
e6: What educational plans does the management team have to inform all investors about the new policy and mitigate any misunderstanding associated with the removal of bias in reported earnings? Additionally, how does the team plan to manage stock price stability during this transition?
